Lillia Nelson

Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
·Nelson Mandela

Hello! This is my first website. If you have happened to land here, then you will be one of the very first people to ever see this website - well done! I love coding and would really like to have a career that involves coding. I also love netball, reading and writing (mostly poems but sometimes mini stories). If you happen to want to read more, then please do...

Poems

These are some of the poems that I have written. I printed these poems out on pocket sized pieces of card and sold them to raise money for my guiding unit. I hope you like them!

A Friend

A friend will never let you down,
A friend will stick up for you,
A friend is totally awesome,
There is nothing a friend can’t do.
A friend is a once in a lifetime opportunity,
A friend is something you can’t just buy,
A friend is something you should keep at all costs,
So thanks for being mine!

Be Yourself

Nobody else is you,
And you are nobody else,
That is for a reason,
So keep being yourself!
If nobody wants to listen,
Make them want to hear,
If nobody decides to stand out,
Take your chance,
And tell them your ideas!

You And Me

You love me no matter what,
You always stick by my side,
I bet you’ve even cheered me up,
Every time I’ve cried.
I hope that no one ever,
Breaks you and me apart,
Because if that ever happened,
It would also break my heart.

My Interests

Netball

I love netball! In my team outside of school, three of my four main friends go there and I have also made some more friends there. My position is usually center or one of the wings.

Writing and Reading

You may have already seen my poems, but I also love free writng. Things like mini stories and extracts from stoies are things that I really enjoy writing. I recently created a mini piece of writing (using Canva, a great way to display your work), which you can view here. I also like to read. If you want book suggestions, reviews, or just want to see the books I have read and want to read, you can click here to go to the books section.

Coding

Yes, of course I had to include coding! I can code the basics of HTML and CSS. I coded a previous website, which started of as just some writing on a document, then became a website, but just on my computer. Unfortunately, it never made its way beyond that point. Now, I have a real website, on the World Wide Web!

Bracelets

My sister makes some amazing bracelets; these are some photos of them!

My School

My school has around 1200 people in it, and I am currently in the youngest year. My favourite subject at school is ICT, as you may have guessed! I have had 4 main friends since my first year. We usually have 6 lessons per day, which last around 50 minutes each, but sometimes the 50 minutes seem to last longer than they should.

Books

This section is all about some my favourite books that I have read.


  • Wonderscape, by Jennifer Bell

    This book is about three kids, who get trapped in the future in an adventure game. They have to play their way home before it's game over.
    This book was great. I loved the adventure theme and the fact that it felt like I was playing alongside the kids. I liked that way I would keep on guessing what was going ot happen next, and even though I had loads of ideas, none of them would ever be right!.

  • The Girl Of Ink And Stars, by Kiran Millwood Hargrave

    This book is about Lupe, and her best friend Isabella. Isabella uses her knowledge of maps and stars to help find Lupe, when she ventures into the Forgotten Territories and gets lost.
    I really enjoyed the magical and adventure aspects of this book! I think that it was a really great read.

  • 5 Feet Apart, by Mikki Daughtry, Rachael Lippincott, and Tobias Iaconis

    This book is love story about two people who can't go within 6 feet of each other, let alone touch, because they both have an illness calld Cystic fibrosis.
    I'm not usually a fan of books that are romantic, but with this one, I couldn't stop reading. It often had me up super late at night trying to read on further!

This section is all about the books I want to read or am reading at the moment.


  • Evernight, by Ross Makenzie
